results.title: What's causing the problem?
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Improving Performance”.
The second step in performance appraisal is the need to identify and agree on the cause of the work problem before discussing solutions. Examples of no agreement on cause are followed by Peter Quarry demonstrating clear agreement on cause.

results.title: What's an Accountant?
results.creator_credit: Neil McClure, CPA Australia and Production Group
results.brief_description: Tania Lacey introduces a program designed to encourage viewers to consider the possibility of a career in accounting. Discusses common sterotypes of accountants, the prerequisites for an accountancy career and the diverse range of employment opportunities. Wherever you may wish to work - “Accountancy can take you there!”

results.title: What's agro-forestry?
results.creator_credit: Roger Seccombe, Nicholas Alexander and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Agro-forestry is a combination of growing pine trees for timber production and pasture for livestock production to gain maximum use of fertilisers and soil nutrients. Various forestry officers and farmers give their opinions on advantages and disadvantages of the scheme.

results.title: What's a good book?: selecting books for children
results.creator_credit: Joanna Foster and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Various librarians and writers give their opinions as to what constitutes good reading material for children. Shows the decision-making process behind the selection of books for children’s libraries and stresses the need to consider why children like particular books. Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: Whaling
results.creator_credit: British Instructional Films and Pathé Frères
results.brief_description: An account of a modern whaling fleet at work; departure of the whale catcher from the Saldanha bay Whaling Station in South Africa; preparations for the hunt; a whale is sighted; aiming and firing the harpoon gun; harpooning the whale; return to the whaling station; treatment of the whale; rendering of meat and blubber.

results.title: Whales
results.brief_description: WHALES - a film as big, beautiful and complex as its subjects. Throughout history the destinies of men and whales have been closely linked. From primitive peoples, pitted against these mighty creatures with just a harpoon and cunning, whaling meant survival. In the 19th century whaling epitomised adventure, excitement and discovery. Today, whaling means big business, power and money. Now its the whales who excite our curiosity and demand our compassion. “Whales” is a thought-provoking look at our complex feelings of love, hate, necessity and fear towards the animals who share our planet as we struggle to balance our needs against their survival.

results.title: Westminster Abbey
results.brief_description: The history of Westminster Abbey is the history of England. Here Parliament once met; here for centuries the Kings and Queens of England have been crowned; and here are buried illustrious Englishmen of all times - sovereigns, statesmen, poets, scientists, musicians. In the nave is the tomb of an Unknown Warrior, brought from Flanders in 1920 as representative of all the nameless British dead in the War of 1914-18. Westminster Abbey is a fine example of early English architecture. Concludes with scenes of the coronation of King George VIth. The film is accompanied by the Westminster Choir and the London Symphony Orchestra with original music composed and conducted by Horace Shepherd. Commentator: Alvar Lidell.

results.title: Westgate Bridge
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Cine Service Films
results.brief_description: The story of the eventful construction of Westgate Bridge which will eventually link Melbourne’s southern and western suburbs. The projected date of completion is now 1977, but industrial disputes and a calamitous collapse of part of the structure have delayed the estimated date of completion.
